6.name: CCSS.ELA-LITERACY.W.6.2
6.description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas, concepts, and information through the selection, organization, and analysis of relevant content.

6.name: CCSS.ELA-LITERACY.W.6.2.A
6.description: Introduce a topic; organize ideas, concepts, and information, using strategies such as definition, classification, comparison/contrast, and cause/effect; include formatting (e.g., headings), graphics (e.g., charts, tables), and multimedia when useful to aiding comprehension.

6.name: CCSS.ELA-LITERACY.W.6.2.B
6.description: Develop the topic with relevant facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other information and examples.

6.name: CCSS.ELA-LITERACY.W.6.2.C
6.description: Use appropriate transitions to clarify the relationships among ideas and concepts.

6.name: CCSS.ELA-LITERACY.W.6.2.D
6.description: Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic.

6.name: CCSS.ELA-LITERACY.W.6.2.E
6.description: Establish and maintain a formal style.

6.name: CCSS.ELA-LITERACY.W.6.2.F
6.description: Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from the information or explanation presented.

6.name: CCSS.ELA-LITERACY.W.6.4
6.description: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience. (Grade-specific expectations for writing types are defined in standards 1-3 above.)

6.name: CCSS.ELA-LITERACY.W.6.5
6.description: With some guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach. (Editing for conventions should demonstrate command of Language standards 1-3 up to and including grade 6 here.)

6.name: CCSS.ELA-LITERACY.W.6.10
6.description: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences.

8.name: VA.ELA-LITERACY.W.8.4
8.description: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience. (Grade-specific expectations for writing types are defined in standards 1-3 above.)

8.name: VA.ELA-LITERACY.W.8.5
8.description: With some guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach. (Editing for conventions should demonstrate command of Language standards 1-3 up to and including grade 6 here.)

8.name: VA.ELA-LITERACY.W.8.10
8.description: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences.
